meanings.sent1: After losing his job, he became insolvent and couldn't pay his bills.
meanings.sent2: The company went insolvent after a series of bad investments.
meanings.sent3: The broke clown joked that he was so insolvent, even his piggy bank had abandoned him.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of a lavish lifestyle came crashing down when she realized she was insolvent.
meanings.sent5: The image of the empty wallet served as a stark reminder of his insolvent status.

meanings.sent1: The family became insolvent after a medical emergency drained their savings.
meanings.sent2: The once prosperous business was now insolvent and struggling to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: The insolvent millionaire found himself counting pennies at the local dollar store.
meanings.sent4: Her bank account, once full, was now as insolvent as a dried-up well.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the 'For Sale' sign outside their home was a clear sign of their insolvent situation.
